Argentina: Santiago del Estero founded by Francisco de Aguirre (some claim 1550)
Chile: Mapuche uprising under Lautaro. Pedro de Valdivia is killed in the Disaster of Tucapel.
China: The Ming capital Beijing was expanded to the south, increasing its size from four to four and a half square miles.
Cuba: The Governor of Cuba relocates to Havana.
England: The Act Against Sectaries 1553 was issued.
Malta: Charles V Mahdia offered to the Order of Saint John but the Order declined, so he ordered the destruction of the city.
Juan de Vega prohibited exportation of wheat to Malta so mills were built to prevent starvation.
